body:
```
[microbenchmarks] Performance differences noted:
Benchmark                                                                                  atm_cas_per_iteration    cpu_time    real_time
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  -----------------------  ----------  -----------
BM_PumpStreamClientToServer<InProcess>/256k                                                                         -6%         -6%
BM_PumpStreamServerToClient<InProcess>/2M                                                                           -8%         -8%
BM_PumpStreamServerToClient<InProcess>/32k                                                                          -17%        -17%
BM_StreamingPingPong<InProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/256k/2                                                    +7%         +7%
BM_StreamingPingPong<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/256k/2                                                 +11%        +11%
BM_StreamingPingPong<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/32k/2                                                  +16%        +16%
BM_StreamingPingPong<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/4k/2                                                   +5%         +5%
BM_StreamingPingPongMsgs<InProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/256k                                                  +8%         +8%
BM_StreamingPingPongMsgs<InProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/32k                                                   +8%         +8%
BM_StreamingPingPongMsgs<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/32k                                                +13%        +13%
BM_StreamingPingPongMsgs<MinInProcessCHTTP2, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/256k                                         +5%         +5%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<InProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/256k/1/0                                 +9%         +9%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<InProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/32k/2/0                                  +5%         +5%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<InProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/32k/2/1                                  +12%        +12%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<InProcessCHTTP2, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/256k/2/0                           +7%         +7%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<InProcessCHTTP2, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/32k/2/1                            +4%         +4%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/256k/2/1     +5%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/32k/2/0                               +7%         +7%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/32k/2/1                               +7%         +7%
BM_UnaryPingPong<InProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/0/2M                                                          +6%         +6%
BM_UnaryPingPong<InProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/256k/256k                                                     +4%         +4%
BM_UnaryPingPong<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/256k/0                                                     +13%        +13%
BM_UnaryPingPong<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/256k/256k                                                  +5%         +5%
BM_UnaryPingPong<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/32k/32k                                                    +12%        +13%
```
Are those bm_diff numbers spurious?  I wouldn't think that a handshaker change would affect the fast path at all, since it only gets run during connection establishment.

I'd like to see bm_diff run again. If those numbers are real, then we'd have an issue. I see it only happens with unary (streaming actually gets faster in three cases). Would this cause more fds to exist in the polling island for the rest of the program's life? this could be a problem that occurs with epollsig and not epoll1

For AF_INET and AF_INET6 addresses, the endpoint fd has already been added to the same pollset_set in https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/src/core/lib/iomgr/tcp_client_posix.c#L305. This should only affect unix domain socket addresses. I'll run bm_diff again to check if the numbers will be the same.

@markdroth The backup poller (#12732) is blocked by this PR. Could you please take a look?
The secure handshake process was driven by the connectivity watcher. After increasing the poll interval in #12732, we started seeing handshake failures.

Thanks for the review!
